alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 11:44PM CDT until May 07 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Johnson. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms this evening. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with the first round of storms. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible as another line of storms moves into the region through 2 am. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Burleson, Cleburne, Keene, Joshua, Alvarado, Venus, Grandview, Godley, Cross Timber, Lake Pat Cleburne, Cleburne State Park, Lake Whitney, Parker, Rio Vista, Cresson, Briaroaks, Coyote Flats, Sand Flat and Egan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
